analysis.business_summary: The program processes customer account information by validating customer existence, generating a new account number, and updating the ACCOUNT datastore in DB2. If successful, it records the transaction in the PROCTRAN datastore and returns the new account number.
business_rules: Customer must exist before processing account information.
Account types must be one of ISA, MORTGAGE, SAVING, CURRENT, or LOAN.
A customer cannot have more than 9 accounts.
business_dependencies: DB2 for ACCOUNT and PROCTRAN datastores
business_workflows: Generate and assign new account number
data_transformations: Convert Gregorian date to integer and back for date calculations
error_handling: If customer validation fails, set fail flags and exit.
If account datastore update fails, decrement counter and exit.
If transaction recording fails, handle with ABEND procedure.
analysis.analysis_notes: The program involves complex interactions with external systems and databases, requiring careful error handling and validation to ensure data integrity.

validation_rules: Account types: ISA, MORTGAGE, SAVING, CURRENT, LOAN
